storyInfo: Frederico insists on climbing the spire to find Arturia and clashes with the Gendarmerie. The scholar leads Ebenholz to safety, with Lessing chasing after them. The Gesatzswächter identifies the elderly scholar as a Sarkaz Lich. Ebenholz hides in House Urtica's chamber, only to find himself ambushed by the Witch King's remains.

attributes.content: Quick, upstairs!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: I heard from a student just now. The Sankta we're looking for is hiding there!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: A pipe organ.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The entire spire is designed in the shape of an enormous pipe organ. It matches the distinguishing characteristics of the background sounds in the cello piece we heard earlier.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: There's a very high chance that the wanted criminal Arturia is hiding here.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Will you keep going up?
attributes.name: Strange Voice From a Sculpture

attributes.content: Originium Arts that use sculptures to synchronize voices. The very same kind I heard at the site of the attack at Karl Schmidt Street.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: So you started working with the 'Witch King's remains' after all, Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: If I told you... I never cared who they were, and had no interest in Leithanien's political turmoil, would you believe me?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The resentment of individuals has never been a motive for your crimes, and I see power struggles and profit as even less likely candidates.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Oh, Federico. You really do know me better than anyone. Everyone else's minds are tainted with thoughts, while you... boring as you are, you and I are alike.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: All these years, I've walked amidst chaos simply to find an even stronger soul.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This journey was no different. I simply accepted the invitation of a few Leithanian acquaintances. That's the only reason for my visit.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Even without my assurances, you should already know in your heart that, no matter what becomes of Leithanien tomorrow, it will have no immediate effect on Laterano.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Then, can I ask of you the same thing the Lupo boy did? That you ignore what you see here?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You're upstairs.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hm. You guessed right. I suppose I could give you a reward and let you see me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How about this? Once my wish comes true, I will be waiting for you at the city gates on the day I leave Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When the time comes, if you still want me to go back to Laterano with you, I promise you I'll think about it.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: An arrest is not a request. You do not have the right to 'think about it.'
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My lovely baby brother, you really... don't know when to give up.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Target spotted!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie A

attributes.content: It's the Sankta who was at the scene of Captain Bordin's murder! Everyone, surround Sonata Spire immediately!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie B

attributes.content: The suspect didn't stop! He ran upstairs!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie A

attributes.content: After him!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie B

attributes.content: One floor after another. Leithanien's spires are always so, so tall.
There are more and more pursuers by the second. Shoes of various ages step on the stairs, each producing a different sound.

The pipes that form the spire's walls are vibrating even more powerfully now. The sound of the organ and the footsteps blend together to form a unique piece, with the squads meandering up the spiral staircase as the performers.
At the front, Federico maintains a steady pace through the entire process. Even his heartrate remains unchanged.
His eyes do not see any of the pursuing soldiers. All he can see is the target before him. A decade has passed, but as though only a day has gone by, nothing has changed.
The last floor.
By leaping past the few dozen steps before him, he will reach his target.
D-Don't move!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: You Sankta... Don't tell me you can actually fly! Just how fast can you run?!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: Good thing the students told me about another shortcut up here... I'm beat!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: I don't care how amazing you are. If you take another step, I'm taking you down!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: So what will you do? Will you declare war on the Leithanian Gendarmerie?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They, too, are enforcers of law, much like your countless coworkers at the Notarial Hall. However, unlike you, they hesitate before plunging themselves into battle. They feel fear.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When you charge ahead in pursuit of your target with no regard for anything else, do you lay eyes on these ordinary men and women for even a moment?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What's that sound? Is somebody talking to you?
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: Are they your buddy? You have friends here, don't you? Did you lure us into an ambush?!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: She is not my friend.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But I am a fellow Sankta.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We both have the same halos above our heads and the same wings on our backs. We're even related by blood.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How will you persuade them that you came all this way not to aid me, but to arrest me?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The misunderstandings of others have never been a reason to waver.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My teammates will be here soon. You won't get away!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: Surrender.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Approach those who misunderstand you and end this pointless pursuit. Clearly explain your position and motives to them.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And then, accept the fact that you have failed once again.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You're right in front of me. I have unearthed evidence of your Arts.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Drop all your weapons! Back away from the talking sculpture!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: I ask that you please calm down.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I am not your enemy.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That's what all smooth-talking criminals say! I trust nothing but my eyes and my Arts Unit!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: You'll pay for what you did to Captain Bordin, Sankta!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: I was not responsible for Loris Bordin's death.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: They're already under the thumb of their most irrational emotions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Your music is affecting everyone in the area.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is this really my doing...? Perhaps this is what they've always wanted, deep down?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I told you long ago. Much like our society, most people's minds are filled with chaos.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You ignore this fact. The only thing on your mind is to sidestep the chaos and find the most efficient shortcut to resolving the issue at hand.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Poor Federico. Have you still not noticed why you've never managed to catch me, even though you've pursued me all these years?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How is a man who's sealed off his own perceptions—unwilling to touch the chaos—supposed to reach chaos itself?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That doesn't concern me.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And you are not chaos itself.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You are a criminal, and your actions beget chaos. Which is why you must be stopped.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Like right now—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I have you now, Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico raises his gun.
The bullet pierces the speaking sculpture opposite him and continues in a straight path until it shatters the wall.
The black-haired Sankta is standing on a balcony not far away. With her back facing the setting sun and a bow in her hand, she smiles faintly.
Meanwhile, beam after beam of Arts light finally reach the executor.
What's going on? I just saw a bunch of Gendarmerie surrounding Sonata Spire!
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: Haven't you heard? It's the Witch King's remains! They're hiding among us in the school, researching Arts used to hurt people! It's so scary! How come none of us ever noticed?!
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: I... I don't believe it. How can you be sure they aren't lying? Their Majesties have long seen the school as a thorn in their side. It's probably an excuse to destroy Ludwigs-Universität—
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: How dare you doubt Their Majesties?! Oh, I get it. You're under the Witch King's remains' influence yourself, aren't you? No, you might even be the one who led them here in the first place. You're one of them!
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: How could you slander me like that? We've shared a room ever since we started school! I even took you to my family's villa by the lake every summer!
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: Hah! And how many of your family's fine possessions in that villa were rewards from the Witch King?
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: Like that set of Arts crystals in the basement, used to observe Catastrophes! They were refined from the ashes of the Infected, weren't they?
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: What did you just—Defame me all you like, but don't you dare drag my grandmother into this! She was the greatest Catastrophe scholar in Einwald, and she died for Leithanien on the northern Sturmland battlefield!
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: My eyes... I'm reporting you and your family to the Gendarmerie and the Empresses' Voice!
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: You wretched... Witch King's remnant...
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: What does that make you? An idiot who crawled your way here by clutching the hems of the Twin Empresses' dresses? If your family didn't so happen to have been on the right side, the lot of you would still be boatmen ferrying the nobles!
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: What do you even know? Did you ever learn to truly respect knowledge? You don't even know which instruments to use for different occasions.
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: Of course, I always knew you looked down on me! Come on! Fight me!
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: What are you doing protecting him, Maeyer? Your family used to serve to the nobles too. Aren't you itching to take this chance to beat up these haughty snobs?
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: The university forbids Originium Arts duels between students.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: When a pack of wild beasts gains knowledge, that doesn't mean they've become civilized. All they've learned is how to use it to hide their fangs.
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: We should be ridding ourselves of this brutish rabble. They'll only tarnish the elegance and values of Ludwigs-Universität!
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: Shut up.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: We worked for centuries to earn the right for commoners and nobles to sit in one classroom together. Neither Ludwigs-Universität or society as a whole should regress.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Out of the way, Maeyer, or you're my enemy too.
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: Hah, you aren't much better than him, Maeyer! The old fart who raised you has been stinking up this place longer than anyone else, hasn't he?
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: I heard he's lived for hundreds of years, and he keeps extending his life with the bones of the dead! Maybe he put you together from bones too?
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: I've also heard rumors. They say even the Twins were molded by Fremont with his witchcraft.
attributes.name: Flustered Student

attributes.content: Nonsense! Fremont and the Witch King were the best of friends! I bet he's the leader of the Witch King's remains!
attributes.name: Anxious Student

attributes.content: —Both of you should get some rest.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: His longsword, wrapped in cloth, blocks the Arts flying toward him from both sides.
Lessing single-handedly stops both of them.
He then lifts his head find even more beams of Arts being flung toward one another.
Firelight, ice crystals, strange energy balls, frenzied flowerbeds, and upside-down fountains. Every spell ever taught in lectures is now interwoven with one another, all at once.
There is a thunderous rumble. A golem running around has knocked over a road sign.
'Ludwigs-Universität.' The shining school crest falls into a cloud of dust.
*pant*... *pant*... I'm really getting on in years. It's only been such a short distance, yet it feels as though I've climbed hundreds of steps.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: I think I heard the sounds of a fight aboveground.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Are the Witch King's remains fighting with those from the university?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You're too weak. Leave the war to the others for now.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: But suppose this war started because of me. I'd have no reason to hide.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You feel guilty. That's only natural.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Fate chose you over the others to live, and that is not necessarily a mercy. I know better than anyone how that feels.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Have you experienced a similar suffering?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I was gravely injured during the final battle, and spent the better part of a year in a confused state. It was Professor Fremont who spent the time and effort to cure me.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: That day, when I finally woke up from my nightmare of being bound to those blood-red steps, the first thought that entered my mind was that... my classmates, friends, and even my lover were all gone.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: In my despair, I climbed to the top of Sonata Spire, wishing to leap from it.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: He found me up there, and I asked him: Was everything I did for Leithanien truly meaningful?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: What happened next? Did you find the meaning you sought?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: He gave me a number of books on the Güldenesgesatz. He told me that whenever I can't answer my own questions, history can.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: So I started studying the Güldenesgesatz, how Leithanien came to be, and the direction it should go. I researched these topics for twenty years.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: And... what answer did you come to?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The problems facing Leithanien have always existed, ever since the birth of the Güldenesgesatz. The cultural differences between tribes, the rift between nobles and commoners, etc. All these have existed for over a thousand years.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: History has proven how difficult it is to change Leithanien, to give its citizens new lives, and to end the endless sacrifices.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: You must possess both absolute power and unbreakable resolve.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Luckily, such power wasn't completely lost, and we're on our way to find it right now.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: So this power you speak of is hidden somewhere on this old campus?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: And by obtaining it, we'll be able to resolve the predicament before us, eliminate the threat of the Witch King's remains, and... change my fate, all at the same time?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It was only my confidence in it that gave me the courage to go against my teacher.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Come, Franz. It's right up ahead.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Nein.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You again?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Don't follow him any further. You shouldn't go there.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Come back with me.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...So you can strap me to a table again and make me a vessel for summoning the Witch King's legacy? In your dreams.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let the dregs of the past be buried by time, and vanish from Leithanien entirely.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They will. I'm doing what I can to ensure that happens.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: But before that—
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: There's no 'before' anything. I've thrown away even a guarantee from the Kaiserinnen. Do you really think I'd listen to the promises of a remnant of the Witch King?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: All I want is to obtain the Witch King's legacy. The people you're talking about—the ones who want to summon the Witch King—are my enemies too.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...Not this again. Is always denying your involvement really that fun for you people? Or are you fighting over who gets credit for what, all to crawl ever closer to that rotten throne?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm sick of all this. Can't you pick some other trophy... and stay away from me?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hm—The stairs beneath us are... vanishing?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: This school is much older than you can imagine. Don't resist the power of history. Give up.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: No—!
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Lessing, not even you can fight a transforming staircase on your own. You'll only hurt yourself.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Ugh—Ah!
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Are you this cruel to yourself, too?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Look, I don't know what Gerhard told you, but don't listen to him.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Rather than someone who claims to be grateful to the Witch King and wants to lock me away in a lab... I'd rather trust someone who once stood against the Witch King and saved my life.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The advent of the Genesis Horn is extremely unlikely to hurt you in any way. The old man and I triple-checked that.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The process may be painful, but not unbearable.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: But you aren't me. What right do you have to make that decision for me?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't, but everyone has a responsibility that only they can bear.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Stop running away. If neither the Voice of Mundane nor the Urtica bloodline are things that you can change, then all you can do is accept them.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Accept them?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The ones who killed my parents and forced the Voice of Mundane into me gave me that same excuse.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The ones who almost turned me into a bomb to blow up a city—the ones who killed my brother—said nearly the same thing!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why do you people always have these self-righteous justifications? Is that really enough for you to ignore all the screams you're creating?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Verdammt... Still not letting go, even after that blow? Are you really so eager to be torn to pieces by the ancient Arts on these stairs?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'd rather die than see you fall into their hands.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: This has always been about more than just you... More than me, as well.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: When Leithanien's future is at stake, any sacrifice is...
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Franz, come.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: We need to keep going.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: This energy enveloping me... Did you save me?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I didn't do it to save you. I just can't stand people like you, obsessed with sacrificing themselves.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Franz...
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Don't walk right into a trap.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Come on, Franz.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: What is this place...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This is where the key I mentioned lies. The key capable of fundamentally changing Leithanien.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: A thousand years ago, sages from the various tribes came together and signed an alliance, witnessed by an all-powerful, immortal caster.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: This pact laid out the relationship between the tribes, established the Kurfürsten system, and set the foundation for Leithanian morality and appreciation of the arts.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: You mean... the Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: In the centuries that followed, the Güldenesgesatz ensured Leithanien's stability.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: That is, until a century ago, when the Siracusans became the first to turn their backs on the Güldenesgesatz and seek independence from Leithanien.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: It was... a bloody conflict, lasting several years. With one part of the choir gone, the Movement became destabilized, and many regions fell into chaos. Leithanien was on the brink of collapse.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: In those dire circumstances, a man stepped forward.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: He realized that the Güldenesgesatz had to be amended. Only by removing Siracusa from the score entirely could the reborn movement unite the nine remaining regions.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: ...The Witch King.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Correct, my child.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: What you see before you is the most mysterious chamber of Ludwigs-Universität, where House Urtica's Arts—circulated for centuries—are gathered. And where Herkunftshorn rewrote the Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: I cannot agree to your methods.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Even if I were willing to believe you that the Genesis Horn truly exists, it is incapable of descending upon Zwillingstürme as it is now.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Hmph, this is exactly why I didn't bother notifying you people. The Gesatzswächter have heads even harder than their helmets.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Your so-called safe and controllable plan to summon the Genesis Horn has already failed.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The Witch King's remnants are hiding within the campus, and with all the relics of the Witch King stored here, they will bring forth a disaster of unprecedented scale.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: And for now, there is only one efficient means of stopping them.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: I refuse.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: We'll evacuate all the students and university staff.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Ludwigs-Universität contains much more of value than just its students and instructors!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I've had tenure here for centuries! Can you even imagine how many precious Arts devices and enchantments there are here?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I understand, but I ask that you please prioritize Leithanien's safet—
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Absolutely not. You say you understand, but that's far beyond your meager capabilities.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: The old man's voice calms down.
His habitual tongue-lashing comes to a halt. As he stares at the man in front of him, the shadow of his skinny body on the wall suddenly grows very tall, like a spire covered in vines.
These spires are not for you to meddle with.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: If you dare suggest destroying them again, I'll throw all of you out at once.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: ...Something isn't right.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The sunset outside the window... disappeared?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The sun's not the only thing that's gone.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Ugh....
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: How very brave of you.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: However, don't even try to touch my shadow again, unless you wish to be dissolved by it.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Herr Fremont's shadow...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's fractured into... innumerable silk strings...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Droste. Lower your Arts.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Do not probe those shadows. His true form is hidden inside. You're not yet strong enough to stare directly into his soul.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Oh? So you've figured out who I am?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Then you must also know that no one who's been thrown outside by me has ever managed to climb back alive.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: If you're brave enough, feel free to see for yourself.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: There is nothing out there whatsoever. I assure you that were you to leap outside, you wouldn't even have time to scream. Your mouths, vocal cords, and limbs would all perish in the darkness.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I've never even heard of Arts like these.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...'Exile.'
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: I've heard it spoken of in legends, but was never sure how much truth there was to it. Until today.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: You've been hiding in Leithanien for so long now. Why choose now to reveal your identity?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Herr Lich?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: A Lich?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You mean... Herr Fremont is a Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hoh, a Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Aside from the immortal bastards of the Royal Court, very few these days have been able to deduce my identity.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: You say I've been 'hiding'... That's a good way to put it, little lamb. When you put it like that, I've stayed in this country for far too long, haven't I?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I never meant to hide my true identity. It's only that I've grown used to being cooped up this spire, with my head buried in the literature here.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: It's you people who forgot who I was.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: And all of you keep bothering me with Leithanien's messes. Sometimes it's the wolves bickering with the lambs. Other times, it's two deer locking antlers. Haven't you wasted enough of my time?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Now scram, and tell Grimmacht that I don't care anymore. Once I've recovered what I loaned from the Genesis Horn, the Liches will be gone from Leithanien for good.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: And if it's not too much to ask, get the hell out of here and never set foot in my holy temple again!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: The Genesis Horn cannot be allowed to descend.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Did you not understand a word of what I just said?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I am no match for you.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: But that doesn't mean Leithanien's Gesatzswächter will give up so easily.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: And what about you, my lovely doe? Do you also seek death?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Let her leave.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Herr Fremont. Surely there is still room to negotiate?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You can stop trying.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Hm? It's you.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hello, Droste... Nein. I should call you Frau Hochberg.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Allow me to reintroduce myself.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: My name is Michael, the personal envoy of Her Majesty Grimmacht.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: So you're another Empresses' Voice?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I am not.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: An Empresses' Voice serves both Kaiserinnen at once.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: While I belong only to Grimmacht.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: ...Can I take that to mean that we're enemies?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The last time we met, I already told you that we might walk different paths.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: What are you dawdling around for, wolf cub? Hurry up and throw them out of here!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: ...Right away.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Herr Reiner, Frau Hochberg. These are Grimmacht's orders.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I am to assist Herr Fremont and ensure that the Genesis Horn makes its advent on Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: But why?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: First, because this was Grimmacht's promise to Herr Fremont.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: As a show of gratitude to the Liches' contribution to Leithanien over the past millennium, and to foster a continued, long-lasting friendship, we will help Herr Fremont retrieve what once belonged to him.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Second, if there's anyone who has the right to use the Genesis Horn, it can only be my liege.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Your liege.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Singular.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Don't let him get to you, Droste.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: It doesn't matter if it was Grimmacht or Ewigegnade who wished for this. There's no reason for you to get involved.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: House Hochberg has already sacrificed too much for the conflict between the Witch King and the Twin Empresses, and for the Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: I will see you out of here safely... even if I must put my life on the line.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: What's going on?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Why is the spire... shaking?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: It's not the spire that's shaking. It's the ground beneath us.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The shadow is fracturing. Something is trying to make its way through.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Is there something underneath the campus's plate?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: House Urtica's secret chamber... Those stupid sheep barged into my underground space!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Fremont, you fool! You've been in Leithanien for far too long. You've contracted the stupidity of these bighorn sheep!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Thank goodness... The legends were true. The old man was telling the truth.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: All these enchantments and Arts devices... Every last one perfectly preserved.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: This is living history! Not even the greatest history books were able to go into such fine detail about the situation!
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Wait, this is...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: A silhouette emerges from the darkness.
Followed by another, and another.
Their robes, hoods, and masks have not changed at all in the past twenty years.
A silhouette he could not be more familiar with emerges from the nightmare that's plagued him for his entire life, and steps right in front of him.
Welcome back to your territory—
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: —Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Professor Hoffmann!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What is it, Franz?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Look what I just found... This is an Arts scroll that's been missing for ages!
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: And this! It can't possibly be the brass instrument used by Herkunftshorn himself, can it? There are treasures here far more valuable than I ever imagined!
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: My... My head... It hurts, verdammt!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why now, of all times? When it's the most dangerous...? No, I can't fall here.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Professor... Hoffmann... Please go...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I... I'll... protect you...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Franz? What in blazes are you talking about?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Lessing was right. I can't keep running away.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: All this time, there's always been someone protecting me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: All the people by my side... first it was that lady, then the respectable Gendarmerie, then Herr Czerny, and... him. All of them, more willing to sacrifice themselves than I.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But this time, I'll do it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'll kill myself here. I still have the Voice of Mundane they love so much... That should be more than enough to blow this chamber of evil to smithereens.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Grab what you want... while you still can... Go... Hurry...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's time you got some rest, you silly child.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: What... did you say?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: My life's work is about to be realized, but how am I supposed to accomplish all this without you?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: This is the second time.
Someone holds a brass instrument up high and violently strikes his head.
'Graf Urtica.'
Many years ago, he woke up to find himself shackled to that chair. In the ten years since, he was granted this name.
He never wanted the title of Graf, and he despised the name Urtica more than anything. Even the name Franz, an old-fashioned name used by countless noble children, is something he has always loathed.

In that spire standing tall in the center of the Urtica Grafschaft, he tried to escape that chair again and again. After all, it was never him that the nobles reporting on the affairs of the Grafschaft truly cared about.
They knew each other well, which is why the guards only ever came early in the day, to drag him from the curtains to the chair.
After a long time, he would finally be allowed to roam the spire aimlessly. Not even the guards noticed him then, until the next morning arrived.
The days went by in that vicious cycle.
If he hadn't tried to run even farther afield, hadn't thought about the other person suffering a similar fate, hadn't tried to resist, and hadn't been shown any hope whatsoever...
Then perhaps he would have been bound to that chair his entire life.
But then, today, he finds himself caught once again. And behind him is yet another familiar chair.
Its shadow is simple, elegant, and entwined with thorns. At a single glance, it feels as if his eyes, brain, and heart have been pierced with intense pain.
Even the cheers around him are similar.
It's just that, this time, they call him—
'Witch King.'
